capabilities.name: Agent Mode
capabilities.description: Autonomous coding agent that breaks work into steps, edits files, runs commands, and self-corrects. Supports local, background, and cloud agents.

capabilities.name: Extension System
capabilities.description: Third-party agent extensions and custom agent skills that integrate into Copilot workflows. Distributed via the VS Code marketplace and GitHub Copilot Extensions marketplace. Extensions can provide custom tools, agent skills, and slash commands.

capabilities.name: Prompt and Context Inspector
capabilities.description: Chat Debug View ('Developer: Show Chat Debug View') showing full per-request details: system prompt, user prompt with resolved mentions, attached context (files, symbols, workspace items), model response, and tool call inputs/outputs. Exportable via right-click. Chat Customization Diagnostics lists all loaded agents, prompt files, instruction files, and skills with load status. Workspace Index Status bar icon shows indexing progress.

sources.description: VS Code Copilot settings reference (developer/debug settings including Chat Debug View)
sources.excerpt: VS Code Copilot settings reference covering developer and debug settings including Chat Debug View configuration options.

sources.description: VS Code Copilot FAQ and troubleshooting (diagnostic commands)
sources.excerpt: VS Code Copilot FAQ and troubleshooting documentation covering diagnostic commands and common issues resolution.

capabilities.name: Debug Logging
capabilities.description: Two Output panel channels ('GitHub Copilot' and 'GitHub Copilot Chat') with trace-level logging via 'Developer: Set Log Level'. MCP server debugging via 'MCP: Show Output' and development mode with file watching (auto-restart) and debugger attachment (Node.js, Python). Chat Diagnostics command for network reachability checks. Nine dedicated MCP management commands in Command Palette.

sources.description: VS Code Copilot setup documentation (troubleshooting, output channels, trace logging)
sources.excerpt: VS Code Copilot setup documentation covering troubleshooting, output channels, and trace-level logging configuration.

sources.description: VS Code Copilot MCP servers (includes MCP debugging and development mode)

capabilities.name: Usage Tracking
capabilities.description: Telemetry inspection via 'Developer: Show Telemetry' and telemetry.log access. Session-level metrics visible in Chat Debug View response details. Extension developers can instrument via createTelemetryLogger() and onDidReceiveFeedback() APIs for tracking success metrics.

sources.description: VS Code telemetry documentation (Developer: Show Telemetry, telemetry.log)
sources.excerpt: VS Code telemetry documentation covering Developer: Show Telemetry command, telemetry.log access, and privacy settings.

sources.description: VS Code Extension API telemetry guide (createTelemetryLogger, onDidReceiveFeedback)

capabilities.name: Lifecycle Hooks
capabilities.description: Eight hook events (SessionStart, UserPromptSubmit, PreToolUse, PostToolUse, PreCompact, SubagentStart, SubagentStop, Stop) execute shell commands at agent lifecycle points. PreToolUse can allow/deny/modify tool input; PostToolUse can block further processing. Configured in .github/hooks/*.json or .claude/settings.json (cross-tool compatible format). /hooks command opens interactive configuration UI.
limitations: Preview as of VS Code 1.109.3, configuration format may change

sources.description: VS Code Copilot customization documentation (lifecycle hooks configuration)
VS Code v1.109 release notes (lifecycle hooks preview announcement)
sources.excerpt: VS Code v1.109 release notes covering new features including lifecycle hooks preview announcement for Copilot.
